website_summaries.verdict: If you have more than one dog, giving each his own treat can prevent fighting. This 15-pack of high-quality bullies is an economical way to keep all your dogs happy and busy.
pros: The perfect size for small-to-medium breeds, these 5- to 6-inch bully sticks are sourced from Argentina, and come from free-range, grass-fed bulls
Highly digestible, good for a dog's teeth, and full of protein
No preservatives or other harmful additives
cons: As with all bully sticks, the odor is the bad part for humans, but a wonderful characteristic of the treat as far as your dog is concerned

customer_reviews.title: This product from Argentina!
customer_reviews.text: No where in the product description does it state "from argentina" , I only purchase USA products for my dog, and in the description state they are processed USDA, hand packed and inspected, shipped from florida. With all the recalls on pet products from other countries, I will be returning this product. Their description needs to state Argentina!
customer_reviews.author: bkrmama

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THESE - NOT WORTH THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I buy bully sticks all the time for my 30 lb doodle. I always buy the 6" sticks so that he finishes them off. He doesn't like to chew on old ones. These bully sticks are tiny and they are hollow! I am so disappointed in my purchase. These are in no way worth $25. I do not recommend these at all. You can find thicker and solid bully sticks for the same price. Look at the picture. These bully sticks are slightly wider than a pencil. Unreal. I wasted my money. I should have just stuck with Best Bully Sticks and not purchased these.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best Bully Stick Product tried on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: We have found this "bully stick" product the best of three selections we have tried on Amazon. Nice thickness to the bully sticks with minimum odor. On other products, thickness varied with a significant number of thin diameter pieces. Longest lasting of the bully sticks we have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Jim D

customer_reviews.title: Great product, will continue to buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second order for my 18 week old Mini Aussie, he loves these things. People often complain about the smell but it really isn't bad, I only notice it when he has been chewing on it and gets right in my face. Quality of this brand is great, they certainly keep my little guy entertained.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Happy Dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these. Up until now Greenies were her favorite treat. Those last about 30 seconds or less. These Bully Sticks last her hours and sometimes longer. It keeps her happy and busy. Probably a good stress buster for her and helps clean teeth as well. I would give them 5 stars but the price is quite high. I give her one every other day so we don't run out so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Two paws up for these bully sticks
customer_reviews.text: The dog is going to give a review of these Bully Sticks through his photos... Only comment from me is that he not only enjoyed the chew, but also rolling on it, so even though it is low odor, it is not completely odor free. But its barely noticeable to me.
customer_reviews.author: mjh999

customer_reviews.title: Gave our 14w old standard poodle explosive diarrhea.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for our 14w old standard poodle puppy. She has had other brands with no trouble. We gave one to her and she had explosive diarrhea multiple times in one evening. She had barely chewed the end of it, so it’s not like she had too much. We watch her like a hawk and she only eats Fromm, so we know she didn’t eat anything that could have caused the problem. We took it away, and boom, normal BMs. Gave it back, and she had explosive diarrhea again. Will not buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Very thin- very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought these before (on clearance at a big box store) and my dogs loved em and they lasted days- so I finally but the over priced bullet and am now convinced I HAD to be sent the wrong ones. They are SO THIN! Apparently They have a package called extra thin- which I did not buy. But they didn’t last 30 mins and are NOT WORTH THIS PRICE- they are basically jerky
customer_reviews.author: K. aguirre

customer_reviews.title: Have things changed in recent production batches ?
customer_reviews.text: I am usually a fan with these bully sticks. They last long and keep my rat terrier , Piper , busy. However my last two bags the sticks had a more brittle nature and the color had a reddish tinge to some of Them. They didn’t last as long. I’m giving it one more try to see if it was just a fluke and then will decide if this isn’t her forever brand. If you asked me two months ago I’d have given it 5 stars. So something is happening in production
customer_reviews.author: amazongroupie

customer_reviews.title: My Dogs LOVE These!
customer_reviews.text: These are some great treats! Both my dogs love them and they can last for a while. I have 2 small dogs around 20lbs. They are not great chewers, so perhaps these would not last for a larger dog, but for my dogs, they are a great size. It's actually not unusual for them to have a chew that they will enjoy for 2-3 days before I take it away when it gets a little too small. They will chew for about 15 mins at a time and then revisit it over several days. These have a slight smell, but for what they are, it is nothing that bothers me. They don't stain furniture or carpet or leave an odor.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie

customer_reviews.title: Good at first... But made my pups sick. Bad batch?
customer_reviews.text: My pups absolutely loved them.... until the second bag. They were throwing up for two days after giving my pups these. I looked through the bag to investigate and found a popcorn-like mass on one of the pizzles! I'm thinking it's possibly a mushroom/fungus growing? Be careful with this brand. Pups are ok now but I'm not giving them pizzles for awhile...
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Our Puppy Enjoyed These Treats, but They Don't Last Long
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy loved these bully sticks, but we noticed she went through these so fast. She is a mini dachshund puppy and it only took her 1 1/2 days to finish one. We scaled back by giving it to her only when we needed to keep her occupied while we were busy. We ordered the bag with 15 sticks and she was done in less than a month. We are going to try the spiral version since it looks more challenging and hopefully it will slow her down. I give it 5 stars because she loved them; 4 stars because they don't last long.
customer_reviews.author: QB

customer_reviews.title: Our dogs LOVE these chew sticks!!
customer_reviews.text: We have two pups that love these sticks. We mainly got it for our 5 month old Pug but we also have a 9mo Minni Aus Shephard that loves them as well. The Pug is very hyper and giving her one of these sticks will calm her down and keep her occupied for quite some time! You will not be disappointed. It asked for a rating on the scent. No bully stick smells like cinnamon!! But it does not stink or produce a pungent odor. If you stick it up to your nose then again, you will find many other things that we humans would rather smell :)
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Avoid these for the safety of your pup!
customer_reviews.text: I just got back from the vet and after $250 in tests and prescription meds, she told me these bully sticks are to blame. My pup woke me up at 3am and couldn't get outside fast enough because her diarrhea was so severe. She was vomiting, and lethargic. The vet said the NIH did a study on these and found 4% of them had MRSA, 4% had tetracycline-resistant e. Coli & 4% had clostridium difficile. I thought they were cooked and therefore safe but I was wrong. Save yourself and serious money, sleep and anxiety and buy Greenies instead (my vet recommended them as an alternative).
customer_reviews.author: Mook

customer_reviews.title: golden retirever puppy LOVES these
customer_reviews.text: we have a 5 month old golden retriever puppy and he absolutely LOVES these things. He used to take a while to chew them when he has his baby teeth. Now that he has his adult teeth he can get through them pretty quickly. make sure to always supervise your dog when giving them this as I find once he gets about half way through he try's to swallow the whole stick with out chewing it. I have to hold onto it while he chews it so he doesn't gulp it down. Note: they are very stinky but dogs love them!
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my puppy busy
customer_reviews.text: My puppy LOVES these bully sticks. They have been a real life saver. Giving him one of these works to get him to stop bad behaviors like biting and jumping on me. One stick lasts him about 2 days. He hasnt had any tummy problems and has been eating these for about a month. They smell really bad, especially fresh out of the package. However, bully sticks always smell nasty. I think dogs must enjoy that smell because it seems my puppy likes them even more when they are fresh and stinky.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Small means narrow
customer_reviews.text: These are very thin/narrow bully sticks. The title says small, and I thought that meant short (5-6"), but the ones we got are very skinny too. They are less expensive than other brands, so I guess that is why. Good quality, low to no odor. Our dog is a powerful chewer, so she is going through these pretty fast. Would be best for small/medium dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Lola Lu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect treats for dogs
customer_reviews.text: I had other bully sticks the dogs were using & liked & I started these new ones today. Although pricey since I use 2 every day it is worth it to see my dogs wanting & chewing on these.
customer_reviews.author: Sissy

customer_reviews.title: Fake reviews - thin as a sharpie marker, misleading photos
customer_reviews.text: Beware of fake, paid reviews - check reliability of reviews using fakespot. This one is rated a C which means about half the reviews are fake/inflated. As you can see in my photos, these are thinner than sharpie marker. My 20# dog goes through these in literally 6 minutes and 51 seconds. And you don’t realize how scrappy these pieces are until you open up the package and take them out to hold them. You can’t tell from the little window they have on the packaging. These are like toothpicks for them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First order I got the bully sticks were perfect. Nicely thick and properly shaped
customer_reviews.text: First order I got the bully sticks were perfect. Nicely thick and properly shaped. The bully would last for two days. Nice shape and lasting. This new order the stick have all different shapes and thin. My yorkie can go through one in an hour. I know that size can change because it's natural but this quality was not good. Not sure if I will purchase again. I thought I had found my brand. I tried the Best Bully and the product quality dropped also.
customer_reviews.author: PRECIOUS

customer_reviews.title: My corgi loves them
customer_reviews.text: This is my third time to order these bully sticks. They are the right size for my corgi and shd loves them. I love that they are made in the United States.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty excited to try these for my 15 week old puppy who likes to chew (teething!). Gave one to her the day we received them. When I opened the bag the smell hit me like a ton of bricks (awful) but when she was eating them I didn't have a problem with the smell though. But she ate the one and she had it completely gone in under 7 minutes. Bummed. For the price just not worth it. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Most of the Bully Sticks are white.  My dog will not chew on the white Bully Sticks.
customer_reviews.text: When I first ordered Bully Sticks a couple years ago the Bully Sticks were brown in color or reddish-brown. My dog loved them. My recent orders have had light-colored or white colored Bully Sticks. My dog will not chew on the light-colored sticks. Must be a flavor difference. I received my 3 packet order yesterday & most of the sticks were white. My wife & I were very disappointed. I would like to return & replace these 3 packets with brown colored Bully Sticks. Why did the product change to a light-colored stick?? Please advise me how to replace these 3 packets with brown-colored Bully Sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nature Gnaw is our Bully's favorite Bully Stick!
customer_reviews.text: Abby loves nature gnaw Bully sticks, all of them. I myself, want them to last a long time so I can get something done. Abby is 9 months old, she weighs 45.5 lbs, pure Bull Terrier! We have bought the Gnaw sticks three times and once we got really thick ones! She loved them and didn't finish it like I gave her a piece of cheese. They were expensive and I’m guessing, 6 in the package. I usually don’t order in small amounts but I guess I will start looking for them. Nature Gnaw is our favorite bully stick! Let’s have a sale once in awhile!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara K.

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love them
customer_reviews.text: My three little dogs,all under ten pounds love these things.I have never given my dogs chews before because i was afraid of choking ,but the experts say this type of chew is very good and highly digestible.They are a little pricey so i only give them a half of one once a week.It takes them a couple of hours to go through one,keeps them occupied,they love chewing on them,they do freshen there breath by cleaning there teeth,there smell is not that bad but everybody's nose is different.They do come in different sizes for bigger or smaller dogs .I bet you and your dog will like them too.
customer_reviews.author: RickieDean

customer_reviews.title: Irradiated in very small letters on back.  Not for my Doxie.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I looked through the the labeling carefully enough. But after I received the package of Nature Gnaws Small Bully Sticks - 100% All-Natural Grass-Fed Free-Range Premium Beef Dog Chews it indicates the bully sticks are irradiated on small lettering on back on package. I'm very careful of what my Doxie eats and he DOES NOT eat irradiated food.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big difference between extra small and small
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased these for years and years. They are rather expensive, but were worth it. I snip them in half with garden shears to make them last longer due to their high cost. I've noticed recently their extra small have been greatly reduced in size, making them not worthwhile. I went to the small size which are so much larger they are not acceptable to give my dogs nor can I cut them in half without risking getting hurt. What happened to the quality control?
customer_reviews.author: Annie W

customer_reviews.title: Deteriorating Quality for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought this product several times and used to very happy with it. Unfortunately with my last two purchases the quality of the product has gone way down. The bully sticks I used to get were very thick and lasted a long time. Now, they are very skinny and my dog chews through one in less than 15 minutes. If the quality of the product is going to go down, why doesn’t the price? These are expensive things and I won’t be buying any more because the quality has gotten so poor for the price. The picture shows the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: My babies love
customer_reviews.text: My dogs LOVE bullsticks. I wanted to try something new. These are shorter than I normally get. But they beg for more. Has a great beefy smell, just what they love...and this cleans their teeth too. Will buy again. My babies love them.
customer_reviews.author: sooner

customer_reviews.title: Won’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: My dog enjoyed these but man some of them smelled so bad. Like, made our whole living room smell terrible and left our dog with the stinkiest breath. Also, some were so thin that they didn’t take much chewing at all, and she swallowed them in large chunks (I know because she also gets carsick and would vomit up whole pieces of these).
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: These are tiny, skimpy, horrible little bully sticks
customer_reviews.text: We purchase six-inch bully sticks from a wide variety of companies...and these are by far the worst we've ever purchased. They are tiny, skinny, skimpy little things--closer to a gullet stick. It takes our 70-lb Labs about 30 seconds to consume these. What a waste of money...because these are not cheap! This company should be ashamed.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Always stick with natural!
customer_reviews.text: These are some of the only natural ones I’ve found and I’m glad they are natural because a lot of these chew toys dogs are given now can have all sorts of toxins and by products in them including other animals. When I did my research and found that out I was really disheartened because my puppy chews on them before bed and it helps her fall asleep! That’s when I found these and decided to try them! My puppy loves these! She chews them up so fast and they’re all around the house one moment, the next they’re all gone! I’ll definitey be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Cinnabonnie

customer_reviews.title: just don't last
customer_reviews.text: 1. My dog loves these. But my dog will also eat grass clippings and dead bugs, sooo.... 2. They stink. They are NOT odorless. I imagine they're probably less potent than other bully sticks, but still. Stinky fish odor, yeah. 3. I tried these, hoping to find a treat that will actually last for a while. Nope. Gone within 10 minutes. Doggo was happy for those 10 minutes, yes, but, as pricey as they are, I won't purchase them again. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: RocketWare

customer_reviews.title: My puppy loved these
customer_reviews.text: We adopted a puppy from rescue and she is 4 months old. She chews everything! These Bully Sticks help us keep her chewing under control. They last long, she loves the taste, and it shipped quickly. Very good value for the money. Would definitely recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Sharks of Awsome member

customer_reviews.title: Far too skinny
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these packs of 25. They are FAR thinner than the same, more costly, pack of 5. Even little dogs can chew them too well, too quickly, presenting a risk. I ended up discarding all but 4 or 5, making this product VERY costly per stick. I ignored others who complained of this, thinking it HAD to be the same as the 5-pack. Not so. This pack might be suitable for dogs under 10 pounds. That's it. I am sticking to the reasonably-sized 5 pack in future.
customer_reviews.author: Jfd

customer_reviews.title: keeps my dog happy
customer_reviews.text: since there is a wide variety of dog chews it took me a while to find the right ones, Nature Gnaws is giving my dog a great chewing experience and I think they help strengthen his teeth. My dog is 10 months old and I give him a 'chewie' every morning. He has never chewed on anything else so to me this is a success.
customer_reviews.author: Inge C Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Crunchy not chewy
customer_reviews.text: My dog enjoys these no matter what brand. I’ve noticed these are drier and more crunchy than other brands. They are quite short so in addition to the crunchiness they aren’t long lasting enough to occupy him for more than five or so minutes. On the bright side, they don’t make his breath smelly and they also don’t have a big aroma on their own, both of which I appreciate. I haven’t decided if I’ll purchase this brand again or not but I am satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: T. C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: NOT small chews
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard to put a rating on this product. I wanted them for our small dogs, so when it said theses were small, I figured they would be thinner. NOT! They are huge! Now I have chews that will have to go to the neighbors dog and my girls won’t have any. If you have a large dog these would be fine. These are NOT small in size. All in all, I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My sofa is soggy with ecstatic doggy drool...
customer_reviews.text: I just adopted a pudgy, 8-year old dachschund. She wasn't quite sure how to manage eating it but being exceptionally bright, she figured out that she could vertically stuff it between 2 sofa cushions to brace it and chew to her heart's content. Absolutely loved it. They're a bit pricey for me as I live on Social Security but she's worth every penny so I'll keep buying them for her, just not as an every day treat.
customer_reviews.author: Linda White

customer_reviews.title: Taste Test Results
customer_reviews.text: The taste test is in and Nature Gnaws Bully Sticks - 100% All-Natural Grass-Fed Free-Range Premium Beef Dog Chew is the winner. I purchased several other products for comparison and 5 out of 5 times, my Border Collies picked Nature Gnaws, they are long lasting with a taste they love. As owner, I did not notice an odor or discoloration on my pets bed. I am thrilled to be able to provide all natural treat that they chew until they fall asleep at night. $$
customer_reviews.author: Rain

customer_reviews.title: "Sad face" the product took a nose dive.
customer_reviews.text: Sadly I have stopped auto ship. Quality changed. These are pretty expensive and the density of the sticks are now half the size these use to be. Back to finding a resource that fits our needs. My two hooligans were rescued from a horder. Bless their little hearts they had no idea how to play or what toys were. They figured out treats. It took them a minute to figure out the bully sticks. Figure it out indeed they did. Living large and run to their spots and chew away. They love these!
customer_reviews.author: Karen A. Wells

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love these!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time buying this brand. I have to say when you open up the pack it has a slight smell to it, but not one that knocks you off your feet like so many others do. All 4 of my dogs loved them! In fact they had them ate less than an hour. That is the only down fall I have with bully stick. They don't last long. My dogs are small so I can't give them bigger bully sticks. The price is worth it. So much cheaper and you get more than if I were to buy at a local store.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this brand of bully sticks!!!
customer_reviews.text: I buy a package of these Bully Sticks every month for my 2 dogs. It’s such a treat for them! They take the bully sticks from my hands and disappear into my bedroom and I don’t see them for at least a solid hour. They don’t reappear until they have totally finished eating them. I only wish they cost less so I could buy them more often but bully sticks seem to be a costly treat.
customer_reviews.author: Webshopper

customer_reviews.title: 12 Wk old Corgi's FAVORITE!!!
customer_reviews.text: My Corgi puppy Bacino has a mouth full of teeny needle sharp teeth and these small odorless bully sticks keep him busy and occupied, relax him and allow me to work and save all sorts of things that I don't want chewed into oblivion! He has a few other chew sticks but only these are actually finished and returned to over and over!!!! I need to buy more!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Good For Dogs With Lots Of Teeth
customer_reviews.text: I have a hard time finding chews that will last long but aren’t made of junk that will make my dog sick. He loves these and they keep him busy for hours, sometimes longer. There is a smell to them but the smell of the chew is no worse than my dog’s breath already and I’m not the one eating them so I don’t care what they smell like.
customer_reviews.author: ACS

customer_reviews.title: Lasts way longer than others
customer_reviews.text: These are the best bully sticks I’ve found. They’re a little more expensive but last way later than other brands. Perfect for crate training and keeping my rescue pup occupied while I do chores on rainy days.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: Pup Doesn’t Like
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my 5 month German shepherd and he doesn’t like these at all. He’ll take them and put them down and walk away uneaten. They don’t smell or anything but they just must not have much taste since these are the first bully sticks he hasn’t liked. Gullet sticks are his fave though so I guess we’ll just be sticking to those
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My sheepadoodle loves these!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't rate the scent well, because they stink to me, but my Sheepadoodle loves the smell. I also didn't rate the longevity as well, because my dog went through one really quick, but that could be because he like it so well. I'm not sure the rating questions are appropriate. It's hard to know if the scent if for me or for my dog because the two answers are definitely different.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bessenbacher

customer_reviews.title: They’re okay but don’t last
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves them, but they don’t last very long. My pup can eat one in like 45 minutes. This also causes him to have digestive issues because he has consumed the whole thing. The bully sticks I get at the pet store last days if not weeks for my 25 lb. mini Aussie. I won’t be buying these again just so Henley can’t finish one so quickly...
customer_reviews.author: Sarah W.

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love these bully sticks
customer_reviews.text: The bully sticks are quite pricey but no different than other brands. When my dog has a play date and the dogs are getting a little wild playing, I give them bully sticks and they’re occupied for quite some time. My son’s dog barks me every time I visit until I give him a bully stick. They are a hit with dogs. I have them on auto delivery so I don’t run out. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: carol from Jax

customer_reviews.title: Good product-dogs love!
customer_reviews.text: My picky dogs took right to them! I love that they are natural. My dogs gnawed them down a little quicker than I expected, as I wanted to take away when halfway through since they are little dogs, but NO upset tummies despite them chowing down! They looked around for the next 20 minutes trying to find them! Ha! They are a hit!
customer_reviews.author: Beck L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Shih tzu :)
customer_reviews.text: My fur baby Zoey loved these bully sticks. The size is great for a small dog. The price is awesome as well as the quality. She gnaws on one for a few days, hours at a time. We had been buying single bully sticks from a local pet store that cost $6.99 each. This brand is great all around. I highly recommend the brand and bully sticks for pet owners, especially is they're teething or loves to chew on things :)
customer_reviews.author: Lora Nowak

customer_reviews.title: Dixie, my Cocker, loves them!
customer_reviews.text: She got very sick off a pig ear of different brand so we are super careful what treats she gets. I liked the way Nature Gnaws prepares their product. We like things sourced in US, clean and unlikely to cause health problems. I've tried several of Nature Gnaws products, and she loves them all!
customer_reviews.author: JRae

customer_reviews.title: Not worth my money...
customer_reviews.text: Outsourced beef from other countries and lasted my lab about 3-5 mins. I literally gave my dog one, read the back of the package and he was done and had swallowed it before I could get the thing away from him. They don’t last long enough and I’m not a huge fan of the fact he probably has it sitting in his gut right now 24 hours later.
customer_reviews.author: DentalRn

customer_reviews.title: Good bully stick but not my idea of Extra Thick
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves his bully stick. The only problem is it didn’t last very long. I wish they were thicker. So the “EXTRA THICK” description was not what I would call extra thick. This was my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: K. M.

customer_reviews.title: Exceedingly popular if expensive
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly odor-free and far from cheap, but two Golden Retrievers prefer them to anything. One makes them last, the other doesn't, but they both love them.
customer_reviews.author: Monomoy Reader

customer_reviews.title: Nature's Gnaws even for pups with sensitive tums
customer_reviews.text: I've tried every treat in the book for my dog. He's a medium sized pup and loves his treats but eventually each one has either fallen out of favor or caused gastric distress. Finally we have found that anything made by Nature's Gnaws is safe and keeps him happy whether it's an after bath treat or a special occasion. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: munchkin

customer_reviews.title: Great treat
customer_reviews.text: These bully sticks are loved by both our small dogs (Cavaliers). For our dogs one stick will last a few days. They fight over them so we always keep a couple out. They work good to put in their crate to keep them occupied for a while also. The smell isn’t wonderful but it’s not horrible either. Much better than giving rawhide which would be bad for our dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Sonja N. Josselyn

customer_reviews.title: Natural, oderless.
customer_reviews.text: I liked that these chews were thinner than Bully Sticks. Since we have a 4 month old and a 3 year old Cavalier King Charles Spaniels, I do worry about their teeth (molars) so they don't break or chip. You still have to supervise at all times because they are thinner, but they do enjoy them. I will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Linda C

customer_reviews.title: Great Bully Sticks
customer_reviews.text: All three of my dogs love these bully sticks. Slight odor when you first take them out but it subsides quickly and is no big deal. I like knowing that the product comes from a company that has shown in my past buys to be trustworthy. Having three dogs though, I can't buy them as often as I would like due to the price and have to make sure I space these treats at least a week apart or I run out too quick. Two of my dogs are hefty chewers so they don't last very long, and the third one can make hers last all day as long as no one steals it from her.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl Sutterfield

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: All 3 of my dogs love these. I give my big dog a whole one and cut another in half for my two smaller dogs (I use pvc cutters to cut them). They never turn them down, even my picky miniature dachsund. Wish they were cheaper but I don't want to give my dogs junk or Chinese crap.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: my dogs love it. but they are very thin
customer_reviews.text: my dogs love it. but they are very thin. they go through them in a matter of 5-10 mins tops! Plus very stinky and leaves the smell in their breath..... but they like it, so i keep giving.. just no licking allowed afterwards
customer_reviews.author: Marcie M.

customer_reviews.title: My puppy loves these!
customer_reviews.text: To a human, the smell isn't great... but, to a puppy it's terrific! Our puppy really enjoys these, and it entertains him for quite awhile. Those little puppy teeth get a workout with these chews, and they are not rawhide. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Serendipity

customer_reviews.title: Happy Beginning “Bully sticks”🐾🐾🐾
customer_reviews.text: I ordered “nature Gnaws” 5-6 “ bully sticks for sweet pup now 4mo new mixed bred small puppy.She LOVES the scent,licks flavor& plays with this.Knowing she Is teething I asked the owners Steve& Jay what’s a mom to do? Their response was quick& informative info on other products they correctly recommended to us for pups needs TILL she can enjoy her Bully sticks !! Happy ending✌️
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: My small dog loves these
customer_reviews.text: My toy poodle (5.5 lbs) loves these. She started out slow but then started consuming them quicker. When she’s on a roll she can almost get through a whole one in a day, but overall a pack of 6 lasted about a month. I love that they keep her occupied and less bored. They do smell. Just don’t get too close to where they’re eating it. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: They love this chews and it helps the puppy with her ...
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 chihuahuas mixes and one of them is only 11 weeks old. They love this chews and it helps the puppy with her constant need to chew. I get the 5-6 inch and actually wish they were a little longer. They chew them down in a day.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Hunter

customer_reviews.title: The bully stick is smaller than pictured.
customer_reviews.text: It seems to me that the bully sticks are becoming more and more thin as time goes by. I own a 4 lb chihuahua. She can now chew one stick down to a stub in a day, whereas she was unable to before. I’ve bought these regularly over the last two years, but purchased something different this last time.
customer_reviews.author: DRG

customer_reviews.title: Very Different Sizes
customer_reviews.text: Maybe 3 of these were as thick as shown in the photo. The rest were very thin, thinner than my little finger. My 30lb dog devoured them in seconds when most bully sticks last him a week. A waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Whisper

customer_reviews.title: Irresistible for my dog
customer_reviews.text: My 100 lb pibble mix dog, Buttercup, loves these bully sticks. She is a senior rescue dog and has several teeth missing. So, I bought the small sticks thinking it might be too hard for her to gnaw on larger sized sticks. She loves to chew on these sticks with her remaining molars. LOL. She doesn’t play with toys and likes to sleep most of the day away. But, the allure of these sticks is irresistible to her. She is able to gnaw one down in about five minutes as her tail happily wags.
customer_reviews.author: lillabookworm

customer_reviews.title: Great value...quiet happy pups
customer_reviews.text: Our 3-month-old Aussie loves to chew like any other puppy, so these bully sticks are great! He is quite placated by these and one stick can usually last him up to 2 days. His "sister" is a wire-haired dachshund and she adores them too. She's a real power chewer so they only last her a day...maybe 2 if we take it up from her. These are excellent chew sticks to help save you and your furniture from puppy teeth demolition. One small complaint (and it's short-lived) is the thicker ones may smell a bit after they've gotten them good and slobbered up.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Last bag I got was thinner, skimpier peices....
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing in this last bag I just bought.... I've bought this several times now and this bag the pieces just seem smaller, thinner just skimpier all together. I like these because it takes a while for my dog to finish it.... these are going a lot quicker. Just not as good of quality as my previous bags purchased. Don't think I'll buy them again now....
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Bolinder

customer_reviews.title: Great Dog Treats
customer_reviews.text: The thing I love most about these dog chews is how many hours my dog will spend chewing one of these. I've tried so many dog treats and he either chews it up within a few minutes, or is completely uninterested. He's have one of these for a week and he's still going. They are thick, and the length as described by the seller. I did not receive any small pieces in my bag. These are great chews and I will continue to buy from Nature Gnaws.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: I will buy these again!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these and I'm happy to be giving her something that's grassfed and natural. She's a fairly vigorous chewer and can finish one in a single sitting, but I can also take it away halfway through and give back later. It keeps her occupied. She's a jack russell terrier.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: The best I have found
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love bully sticks... I love them because the odor is minimal. I have used several brands but I like these the BEST. Thanks for a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Mama

customer_reviews.title: High price for low quality
customer_reviews.text: Sticks were largely flat, splintered with many jagged edges. They are extremely light and do not last. I have been much happier with Sancho & Lola's bully sticks. Those sticks are more cylindrical, solid, and with smooth edges. For the same amount of money our dogs get much more product which lasts a good deal longer than Nature Gnaws Bully Sticks.
customer_reviews.author: geekgirl

customer_reviews.title: Blah! Smell terrible and don’t last.
customer_reviews.text: These smell so terrible. My puppy likes to sit next to me and chew her bully stick but the smell of this brand is so gross I can’t be near it. The smell lingers on her breath too. Also, she is able to chew through a whole stick in a day but other brands last a week. I guess she likes them so I gave a couple stars for that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I’m not kidding they love to chew
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for!!! I have 4 dogs who can chew away a treat in minutes. I’m not kidding they love to chew. This product lasts!!! Yay!!!!!! And didn’t make their tummy hurt. I’m happy and on a monthly program to always have them available. And my babies are happy!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marti Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great treat for the pups!
customer_reviews.text: My Dachshunds love these sticks - one powers through and eats them in minutes - the other takes his time and it lasts for a half an hour or so! (the review asks e to rate flavor - it have no idea but the dogs eat it so I gave it 5 stars :) )
customer_reviews.author: Terese

customer_reviews.title: A big hit
customer_reviews.text: These have been great for my small terrier, who has been working his way through his first bully stick from this brand. He has a small mouth and had to get some teeth taken out, and these seem hard enough to take time to chew but not so hard that it's impossible for him to soften them up. There's a bit of a smell but it seems pretty subtle - I can smell it only when I get close. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: JJRR

customer_reviews.title: My Chinese Crested prefers these to other bully sticks
customer_reviews.text: I chose Nature Gnaws when I couldn't find her regular bully sticks. When I tried to go back to the regulars which last longer she rejected them. My only issue with Nature Gnaws is how quickly she goes through them and the fact that I cant afford this on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: Myra Peskowitz

customer_reviews.title: Finally a non-toxic chew!
customer_reviews.text: I love the ingredients in these chews! And my dog loves them- she eats them up in about 15 minutes. Only downside is that they smell mildly bad. But not overpoweringly-bad, making the whole room stink like some other all-natural bully sticks. I have bought these twice and will continue to buy them.
customer_reviews.author: K. Barla

customer_reviews.title: picky pup
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old dog suddenly became finicky and refused to accept the brand of bully sticks that I'd been giving her since she was a puppy. I tried other brands, only to have to give them away because she didn't like them. Then we tried 'Nature Gnaws' and she loves them! Specifically, they make thin ones that are great for smaller dogs and seniors. Now she consumes one after breakfast and one after dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Susan L.

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be!!! Buyayer beware!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are about as thin as a pencil, and not just one or two of them, all of them! This is completely unacceptable for 80$! I'm so disgusted that I washed my money on this garbage. This company used to be great, not any more! DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: john hill

customer_reviews.title: Great product I will continue to buy them!
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard to find natural choose for dogs and our dogs love these! Not to mention it keeps them busy for nearly an hour. As soon as we say snack they grab them and run to a corner of the house LOL to make sure the other one doesn’t steal their’s. Great product I will continue to buy them
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Happy doggie, happy life 😄
customer_reviews.text: Loooooves them! I pour them on the floor and let her pick out the one she wants. She plays with the bone and barks at it. Picks it up and throws it, and spins around in a circle with that happy crazy face, that every dog owner knows. She's celebrates her bones!
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: My dog finished one of these off in under 5 minutes when it normally takes him 25-30 to finish off a 6" bullystick. They are extremely light, hollow, and overall such a ripoff. For $25, I expect a much better product. Will never purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: BarFineLongTime

customer_reviews.title: Made dogs sick
customer_reviews.text: Dogs kept getting sick and come to find out it was the treats. These are expensive but my dogs love them. The last several months I bought these my dogs kept getting sick and we could not figure it out. Now I stopped getting this brand and they are no longer throwing up.
customer_reviews.author: number two pencil

customer_reviews.title: A Tasty treat
customer_reviews.text: My wheaten terriers loved these. Started getting when they were just a couple of months old. Compared to other bully sticks, they don't smell. My only complaint is now that the dogs are close to 35 pounds, they go through them in 5-10 minutes instead of days. I do wish they were cheaper... but they are grass fed and free range so the higher price is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: CMG

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love these!
customer_reviews.text: My piggy pup scored not only his, but his buddies and chewed them down. Good size for a treat for medium to smallish canine friends. Does have a smell when opened, but ...nice resealable packaging takes care of that!
customer_reviews.author: DLP

customer_reviews.title: MY DOG GOES CRAZY FOR THIS
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS MY DOG'S FAVORITE SNACK. IT'S GOOD FOR HIS TEETH AND IT'S ALL-NATURAL. COSTS A BIT MORE THAN CRAPPY INDUSTRIAL DOG SNACKS BUT IT'S WORTH IT BECAUSE HE STAYS HEALTHY AND IT GIVES HIM SOMETHING NATURAL TO CHEW ON
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Magic

customer_reviews.title: Arrived as expected but irridated product
customer_reviews.text: These dog chews arrived as expected but it says they are irridated on the package. It may be that all dog chews like this are irridated and this was the only brand that listed it, but I have read of the dangers of irridated foods & I returned it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Cyn

customer_reviews.title: My dogs really love these. They lasted pretty long considering both my ...
customer_reviews.text: My dogs really love these. They lasted pretty long considering both my dogs can chew through just about anything with ease. For the price and quality, you can't beat these. I give these to them as a special treat, not just a daily treat so the bag should last a decent time. I would def recommend and will be getting another package when these are done.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Best snack for busy pups!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing makes my girl as happy as her Nature Gnaws bully sticks. Luna is 7 months old and full of energy. I love these treats, they are excellent puppy sitters, cures her urge to chew on things, and is also a healthy safe digestible snack. My only complaint is they do stink. But I deal with it because she is happy and when she is happy, I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Watson

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: These have been a lifesaver. I’ve tried the bully sticks that take forever to chew through and these. My dog has taken to these only! And while she is teething and wants to bite on everything, they are perfect for keeping her occupied.
customer_reviews.author: Kblandin

customer_reviews.title: These are long lasting and he loves them!!
customer_reviews.text: These are great!! I have a Beagle puppy and was looking for something for him to chew on besides everything in my house. He loves these chews and it occupies him for enough time to drink my coffee in the morning and wake up. They are a little pricey but I am willing to pay it to keep my Beagle occupied. Most other chews he would have eaten in 5 minutes...theses little giya take him about an hour or longer so he can come back to it all day long. They are all natural so I feel so comfortable rust they arent loaded with stuff that isnt good for him!! Thank you for a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Hess

customer_reviews.title: The only treat my dogs will eat
customer_reviews.text: These are the only treats my 5 border collies will eat and I have tried several different brands. I ordered the small size. One stick will last a pup a minimum of an hour. I am so glad these are not greasy on my carpet. I will definitely order again.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Stinky
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money but compared to others we have bought in the past these small awful. Smells like rotting fish, Odorless for us is the way to go. I know others have said the smell isn’t that bad, however the odorless ones make a big difference. The dog still loved them!
customer_reviews.author: Trainer Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: These are not long lasting chews. My 32 pound 5 month poodle puppy can chew them up in about 10-15 minutes flat. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: GoGreenSpartans

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting Chews
customer_reviews.text: My little chihuahua mix loves bully sticks! I thought I would give these a try for the price that they were offered at. I also look at the quality of the product and where they come from, I do not buy anything from China for my fur babies. She really loves them and they seem to last her longer than some other thinner brands. We have these on auto ship so we never run out.
customer_reviews.author: Mel in SM

customer_reviews.title: Dog Approve!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs like them My Golden can chew up a stick in 10m My puppy not so fast My Golden ends up stealing it because she gets tired of it All in all a good purchase
customer_reviews.author: Linda DeFever

product_meta.title: Nature Gnaws Small Bully Sticks for Dogs - Premium Natural Beef Bones - Thin Long Lasting Dog Chew Treats for Light Chewers & Puppies - Rawhide Free - 6 Inch
product_meta.description: Size:5-6" (15 Pack)Nature Gnaws Bully Sticks come from only free-range, grass fed, all-natural beef. That’s it. Premium Long Lasting Bully Stick Dog Chews - The Best on the Market. We partner with traditional cattle ranchers who provide us with the bits of the cow people don’t like — and dogs love. (They keep back enough to share with their own pets, though — bright-eyed herding dogs who relax in front of the fire at their master’s feet every night.) Our Bully Sticks are high protein & super nutritious thanks to the cattle’s healthy, outdoor, natural lives. Bully Stick chew time varies based on your dogs chew strength. More aggressive chewers will chew much quicker and may need a larger size for a longer lasting session. Either way, your dog will absolutely go crazy for our Bully Sticks. Just like we are absolutely crazy for our dogs! We believe that nothing is too good for our dogs — especially if it’s healthy and nutritious!
feature_bullets: SINGLE INGREDIENT DOG CHEWS - Made with only 100% natural premium quality Beef Bully Sticks.
RAWHIDE FREE TREATS – Best alternative to chemically made rawhide bones or manufactured dental sticks.
SUPPORTS DENTAL HEALTH – Chewing helps reduce plaque and tartar for cleaner teeth and fresher breath.

SAFE & RESPONSIBLE COMPANY – Our 5-step safety process includes: fresh raw material sourcing, irradiation, food-grade lab testing, hand packaging in the USA and UV disinfection of our facility. From the farm to your fur baby, we manage, and quality check every single step.
LONG LASTING STIMULATION & TASTY – Perfect reward to occupy and entertain Puppies, Small Breeds or Light Chewing Seniors. Dogs love the tasty beef flavor and chewy thick texture.
